asia pacific college offers many programs under different schools, which school are you interested in
we have different programs under the school of engineering, architecture, computing and IT, management, multimedia arts, and other departments. which one are you interested in
senior high school a two year program open to junior highschool graduates. it  divided into three strands which are STEM, ABM, and HUMSS.

our STEM strand is a specialized curriculum for Senior High School students interested in science, technology, engineering, and mathematics. It provides a strong foundation in these areas and includes specializations in Engineering, Multimedia Arts, Medicine, and IT, offering students hands-on experience and preparation for their future careers.

our humanities and social sciences strand is a specialized curriculum for Senior High School students interested in human behavior and societal interactions. It prepares students for college courses in arts, social sciences, and humanities, providing a strong foundation and critical thinking skills.

our Accountancy, Business, and Management strand is a specialized curriculum for Senior High School students interested in business and finance. It equips students with fundamental knowledge in business management and accountancy, preparing them for future careers in these fields.
the school of engineering consists of computer engineering, electronics engineering, and civil engineering

patterns: tell me more about computer engineering
responses: computer engineering is a four-year program that aims to produce certified computer engineers. it embodies the science and technology of design, development, implementation, maintenance, and integration of software and hardware components in modern computing systems and computer-controlled equipment.

patterns: tell me more about electronics engineering
responses: The Bachelor of Science in Electronics Engineering (BS ECE)  a four-year trimestral degree program which aims to produce certified electronics engineers who can conceptualize, design, and implement innovative electronic, computer, and communication systems, devices, goods, services, and processes.

patterns: tell me more about civil engineering
responses: civil engineering is a four-year program that aims to produce certified civil engineers who can conceptualize, design, and implement innovative civil structures, systems, and processes.

patterns: school of computing and information technology
responses: the school of Computing and information Technologies consists of BS Computer Science, BS Information Technology, and Associate in Computer Technology

patterns: tell me more about information technology
responses: Information Technology is a four-year program that aims to produce certified IT professionals. It embodies the science and technology of design, development, implementation, maintenance, and integration of software and hardware components in modern computing systems and computer-controlled equipment.

patterns: tell me more about computer science
responses: Computer Science is a four-year program that aims to produce certified computer scientists. It embodies the science and technology of design, development, implementation, maintenance, and integration of software and hardware components in modern computing systems and computer-controlled equipment.

patterns: tell me more about associate in computer technology
responses: Associate in Computer Technology is a two-year program that aims to produce certified computer technicians. It embodies the science and technology of design, development, implementation, maintenance, and integration of software and hardware components in modern computing systems and computer-controlled equipment.

our Architecture program is a four-year and one-term professional degree program, focusing on using technology to create innovative architectural solutions for current and future built-environment challenges. The program emphasizes on immersive research design studios, internships with industry partners, and mastering skills related to the fourth industrial revolution, including computational design and cognitive design workflows.

The school of management consists of BS Accountancy, BS tourism management, BS management accounting, and BS Business administration with specialization in Business Management, Marketing and Advertising, and Digital Business

our Accountancy program is a four-year trimestral degree program, guided by industry professionals and built on the pillars of an industry-guided curriculum and the use of Business-IT tools. It aims to produce IT-enabled Certified Public Accountants who are proficient in generally accepted accounting principles.

patterns: tell me more about tourism management
responses: our Tourism Management program prepares students for a variety of careers in the travel industry, including hotel and resort management, restaurant management, airline operations, and more. Graduates are equipped with the necessary wisdom, diligence, and IT skills to excel in the tourism industry, with a special focus on hotel and restaurant operations.

patterns: tell me more about business administration
responses: our Business Administration program is a comprehensive program that provides students with a broad understanding of business operations and management principles. Students can choose to specialize in one of three majors: Business Management, Marketing and Advertising, or Financial Management, each designed to equip them with the necessary skills to excel in their chosen field.
The School of Multimedia Arts consists of BS Multimedia Arts and BS Psychology

our Multimedia Arts program is a four-year trimestral program that provides students with expertise in multimedia design and development, combining IT and audio-visual arts. The curriculum includes computer graphics, 2D and 3D animation, video production, digital photography, digital sound engineering, and game authoring, with application projects and internships to prepare students for real industry practices.

our Psychology program with Specialization in Industrial/Organizational Psychology is an innovative program designed to develop skilled Industrial/Organizational Psychologists who are equipped to meet the evolving demands of the new world of work. The program blends theory and practice through project-based learning, industry-proven best practices, and a focus on technology and data science, with a full-time 6-month On-The-Job Training to produce industry-ready graduates.

our Graduate School offers a variety of master's programs in the fields of Engineering, Computer Science, Game Design, Information Systems, Information Technology, and Management. These programs are designed to provide advanced knowledge and skills, preparing graduates for leadership roles in their respective fields.

Our Master of Engineering major in Computer Engineering is a graduate program designed to cultivate independent computer engineers equipped with advanced technical and theoretical knowledge for professional practice. The program emphasizes industry immersion and professional work, requiring students to demonstrate leadership and management skills, tackle complex problems within a company or organization, and apply best principles and practices in designing and developing solutions.

our Master of Science in Computer Science is a graduate program designed to equip students with the necessary skills to conduct research and formulate innovative applications of computer science principles, particularly in solving computationally intensive industry problems. The program emphasizes the progression from understanding scientific theories, concepts, and principles of computation to generating new knowledge through focused specialization.

our Master in Game Design is a graduate program designed to cultivate students' skills in pipeline management, business development, research, production, and design within the gaming industry. The program, consisting of thirty-six units, emphasizes on core subjects and studio-based learning, culminating in an innovative development project through a six-unit independent study, preparing students for effective communication and leadership in a team-based environment.

our Master in Information Systems is a graduate program designed to equip students with the effective use of information technology (IT) for problem-solving, process improvement, and organizational efficiency. The program, consisting of thirty-six units, emphasizes on core subjects and specialization subjects, culminating in an innovative development project through a six-unit independent study, preparing students for successful business and IT project management.

our Master in Information Technology is a graduate program designed to enhance students' knowledge of IT concepts, techniques, and principles, enabling them to provide solutions to organizational and societal problems. The program, consisting of thirty-six units, emphasizes on core subjects and specialization subjects, culminating in an innovative development project through a six-unit independent study, fostering a strategic skill set in systems application development and the multidisciplinary use of IT for business efficiency and success.

our Master in Management is a graduate program designed to prepare junior officers and first-line managers for executive roles, integrating all functional areas of business management through critical thinking and a business analytic approach. The program, consisting of thirty-six units, emphasizes on core subjects and specialization subjects, culminating in an innovative development project through a six-unit independent study, fostering a comprehensive understanding of business management.
Admission requirements for the B. Arch program may vary depending on the institution, but typically include a high school diploma or equivalent.

the Junior Information Systems Security Association ) promotes the education and helps expand the knowledge and skills of its members in the interrelated fields of information systems security, and information or data processing. intents.tag: Junior Philippine Computer Society (J P C S)
responses: The APC Junior Philippine Computer Society (APC-J P C S) aims to prep its members for their future in the corporate world as an ICT professional by providing complementary experiences aside from  they learn in school. It provides an opportunity to sh experiences and work with other students from different schools, in the pursuit of IT excellence through common projects.

The Asia Pacific College - Microsoft Community (A P C - M S C)  an organization that aspires to acquaint students with the latest in technology and softw development through various Microsoft events, tools, and technologies. Having Microsoft Student Partners (MSPs) in its executive board, the organization  able to obtain promotional paraphernalia and hold both official and Microsoft endorsed events in the school.

Gaming Genesis ( G G )  an organization built to support game design and multimedia art students in their projects involving games. It promotes the creativity and talent of students in the field of gaming and game design, with the goal to contribute in the new gaming industry and bring joy to the APC community through gaming.

intents.tag: Society of Electronics Engineering Students ( S E E S)
responses: Formed to promote a strong foundation of brotherhood and sisterhood by helping each other overcome their weaknesses especially when it comes to academics, the Society of Electronics Engineering Students’ (SEES) mission  to showcase professional, technical development and a paradigm of excellence in applying the principles of electronics technology for the advancement of humanity.

intents.tag: Association of Computer Engineering Students ( A C E S)
responses: The APC Association of Computer Engineering Students (A P C - A C E S) aims to uplift the competency and excellence of the school’s Computer Engineering students through productive and worthy hands-on activities that enhances the skill, broadens the knowledge, promotes social awness, strengthens the bond between each member and establishes grounds for better qualified computer engineers and citizens of the country.

The APC Robotics Organization (APC-ROB ORG) envisions itself to establish a group of robotics enthusiasts who  committed to become involved with the innovative life of robotics. Using robotics as a medium, it inspires the students to take their involvement with basic Engineering and to develop technical experience by leading others.

intents.tag: Founding Organization of Civil Engineering Students (FOrCES)
patterns: Founding Organization of Civil Engineering Students
responses: The Founding Organization for Civil Engineering Students ( FOrCES )  an academic organization of Asia Pacific College for Civil Engineering Students. One of the organization’s purpose  for its members to develop their skills and relationship as aspiring civil engineers. this organization was founded primarily to serve as a platform for the expression of our ideals and aspirations and to foster an environment that  highly conducive to moral, social, and intellectual development, do hereby ordain and promulgate this constitution and by-laws.

intents.tag: Junior Marketing Association (AP J M A)
responses: APC Junior Marketing Association (APJMA) participates in activities that will help the members develop their skills and further expand their knowledge in marketing. It organizes events and activities that support the students to be productive and cultivate their talents for the common good at the same time.

A unified accountancy student organization, with a mission of pursuing academic excellence in the field of accountancy and with the objective of refining raw talent and potential, the APC Junior Philippine Institute of Accountants (JPIA)  composed of young accountants that execute activities to promote camaraderie among its members..

intents.tag: Business Management Group-Junior People Management Association of the Philippine

responses: The Business Management Group-Junior People Management Association of the Philippine APC’s purpose  to provide opportunities for students to work together and mold their leadership skills dedicated to serving the school, the industry,and society.

The Tourism Management Society (TM SOC) aspires to administer activitiesthat will help create awness on the role and importance of tourism. It develops events for the APC community to know more about tourism and appreciate in turn  it can offer. The organization also aims to inculcate in the minds of its members the value of environmental conservation and the concept of sustainable development for the long-term benefit of the Philippine tourism industry

The APC Junior Financial Executives purpose  to unite the Financial Managementstudents of Asia Pacific College and expose them to the financial sectors and nationwide financial activities. APCFO also 
welcomes all students majoring in business to be introduced to the realm of finance and enhance their knowledge in finance, from the basics to advanced.

The APC Psychological Society (PSYCH SOC) aims to promote general mental health awness among the members of the APC community and minimize the stigma surrounding mental illnesses to create a better understanding of mental health.

Through the years, Bahay Bombilya’s mission  to provide support for the members of the organization by equipping them with more knowledge, skills, and experience in multimedia arts that can be used for future jobs. CINEMASOMA  a student interest organization open to all students of Asia pacific College, Rams. The objectives of the organization  to equip members with methods and skills that have something to do with film production.

APC Band envisions itself to be the premier music maker of Asia Pacific College. patterns: Does A P C have a Choir
Does A P C have a Chorale
responses: APC Chorale improves their skills and personality to achieve innovation not only in the field of singing, but also as future individuals in the world. It promotes singing as a group rather than performing solo, with the goal to achieve unity as singers and of meeting at a one common line.

patterns: Does APC have a dance group
responses: The APC Dance Company (APC-DC) seeks for members with exceptional talent in dancing and who  very much willing to pursue and develop  they already have. Driven by passion, the organization aims to develop professional and well-rounded students that excels academically, administratively, and artistically

APC Strings create ties to connect musicians and aspiring musicians through their passion. The group aims to form a community that will connect people and break borders through music, and promote responsibility, patience, commitment, time management and hard work among its members. It also trainsits members to be confident and master their instruments

Teatré Phileo  driven by the passion to promote teamwork, develop leadership, and produce value-oriented and socially relevant plays and productions that showcase the organization’s team players’ unique talents in performing arts. It aims to produce plays that do not only entertain, but also promote the relevance of theatre in today's society.

The Rotaract Club of Asia Pacific College, a socio-civic organization sponsored by the Rotary Club of Makati Paseo De Roxas, brings together committed individuals ranging from 18-30 to take action in their community, develop their leadership and professional skills, and have fun through service. The organization  a movement that raise leaders 
that will work together to become a network of help to the world.

The Student Organization Association of Regents (SOAR)  a student organization which aims to cultivate future leaders and embed the attributes of an APCian Graduate in every individual. SOAR Officers  the ones in-charge of the termly Student Forum, the annual Student Recognition,Organization Fair, and the much-anticipated APC Fest.
APC Pwersa Mixed Martial Arts (APC-Pwersa MMA) wishes to improve the members through training and discipline by teaching them Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu.

patterns: Does you have a debate club
responses: As APC’s official debate and public speaking organization, APC Speaks’ objective  to empower the members to express themselves freely and confidently without fear of judgement.
APC HiRAYA  an academic organization open for all students of Asia Pacific College who has interest in humanities and social sciences.
Jesus Impact provides free concerts, lectures, seminars, and training to students, teachers, staff, and other stakeholders of the school.
Flickers Photo Society’s mission  to provide an outlet for the heightening of photography skills in different fields like landscape, events, people, and nature.
Fitness Squad. The purpose of this organization  to recreate APC's fitness culture in both the workplace and in the classroom.
The RAMS Flag Football aims to promote the young athletes of Asia Pacific College with their development of character, sportsmanship, discipline, and athleticism.
Ramshakers  a Christian organization of Asia Pacific College, that focuses on discipleship and growing the body of Christ.
APC-AI Atheneaum of Information implore the aid of the Divine Providence in order to effectively promote, utilize and enhance our knowledge in Information.
Asia Pacific College  granted an Autonomous Status by the Commission on Higher Education for its efforts on academic standards and excellence.
Asia Pacific College  held as a Center of Development in Computer Engineering by the Commission on Higher Education.
Asia Pacific College  held as a Center of Excellence in Information Technology by the Commission on Higher Education.
Asia Pacific College  granted with a certificate of accreditation in Computer Engineering by the Philippine accrediting association of schools, colleges, and universities.
Asia Pacific College  granted with a certificate of accreditation in Accountancy by the Philippine accrediting association of schools, colleges, and universities.
